raw: * @type {Array} private list of global event monitor functions

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Array} private list of global event monitor functions

raw: * Adds a global event monitor function which is called for each event fired
* anywhere in the application. The function is called with the signature
* (target: {@link qx.core.Object}, event: {@link qx.event.type.Event}).
* Since for performance reasons, the original event object is passed,
* the monitor function must not change this event in any way.
* @param fn {Function} Monitor function
* @param context {Object?} Optional execution context of the function

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a global event monitor function which is called for each event fired anywhere in the application. The function is called with the signature (target: {@link qx.core.Object}, event: {@link qx.event.type.Event}). Since for performance reasons, the original event object is passed, the monitor function must not change this event in any way.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: context {Object?} Optional execution context of the function
@param.description: Optional execution context of the function

* @param fn {Function} The global monitor function

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes a global event monitor function that had previously been added.

raw: * Remove all registered event monitors

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove all registered event monitors

raw: * Sets the global event monitor. Not compatible with the {@link

* @param fn {Function?} the global monitor function

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the global event monitor. Not compatible with the {@link qx.event.Manager.addGlobalEventMonitor} API. Will be removed in v7.0.0. Use {@link qx.event.Manager.addGlobalEventMonitor} instead.

raw: * Get a copy of all event listeners for the given combination
* of target, event type and phase.
* This method is especially useful and for event handlers to
* to query the listeners registered in the manager.
* @param target {Object} Any valid event target
* @param type {String} Event type
* @param capture {Boolean ? false} Whether the listener is for the
*       capturing phase of the bubbling phase.
* @return {Array|null} Array of registered event handlers. May return
*       null when no listener were found.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get a copy of all event listeners for the given combination of target, event type and phase. This method is especially useful and for event handlers to to query the listeners registered in the manager.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether the listener is for the
       capturing phase of the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether the listener is for the
       capturing phase of the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Array|null} Array of registered event handlers. May return
       null when no listener were found.
@return.description:
Array of registered event handlers. May return
       null when no listener were found.

raw: * Returns all registered listeners.
* @internal

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns all registered listeners.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} All registered listeners. The key is the hash code form an object.
@return.description: All registered listeners. The key is the hash code form an object.

raw: * Returns a serialized array of all events attached on the given target.
* @param target {Object} Any valid event target
* @return {Map[]} Array of maps where everyone contains the keys:
* handler, self, type and capture.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a serialized array of all events attached on the given target.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map[]} Array of maps where everyone contains the keys: handler, self, type and capture.
@return.description: Array of maps where everyone contains the keys: handler, self, type and capture.

raw: * This method might be used to temporally remove all events
* directly attached to the given target. This do not work
* have any effect on bubbling events normally.
* This is mainly thought for detaching events in IE, before
* cloning them. It also removes all leak scenarios
* when unloading a document and may be used here as well.
* @internal
* @param target {Object} Any valid event target
* @param enable {Boolean} Whether to enable or disable the events

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This method might be used to temporally remove all events directly attached to the given target. This do not work have any effect on bubbling events normally. This is mainly thought for detaching events in IE, before cloning them. It also removes all leak scenarios when unloading a document and may be used here as well.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: enable {Boolean} Whether to enable or disable the events
@param.description: Whether to enable or disable the events

raw: * Check whether there are one or more listeners for an event type
* registered at the target.
* @param target {Object} Any valid event target
* @param type {String} The event type
* @param capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to check for listeners of
*         the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
* @return {Boolean} Whether the target has event listeners of the given type.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Check whether there are one or more listeners for an event type registered at the target.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to check for listeners of
         the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
@param.description:
Whether to check for listeners of
         the bubbling or of the capturing phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the target has event listeners of the given type.
@return.description: Whether the target has event listeners of the given type.

raw: * Imports a list of event listeners at once. This only
* works for newly created elements as it replaces
* all existing data structures.
* Works with a map of data. Each entry in this map should be a
* map again with the keys type, listener,
* self, capture and an optional unique.
* The values are identical to the parameters of {@link #addListener}.
* For details please have a look there.
* @param target {Object} Any valid event target
* @param list {Map} A map where every listener has an unique key.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Imports a list of event listeners at once. This only works for newly created elements as it replaces all existing data structures. Works with a map of data. Each entry in this map should be a map again with the keys type, listener, self, capture and an optional unique. The values are identical to the parameters of {@link #addListener}. For details please have a look there.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: list {Map} A map where every listener has an unique key.
@param.description: A map where every listener has an unique key.

raw: * Add an event listener to any valid target. The event listener is passed an
* instance of {@link qx.event.type.Event} containing all relevant information
* about the event as parameter.
* @param target {Object} Any valid event target
* @param type {String} Name of the event e.g. "click", "keydown", ...
* @param listener {Function} Event listener function
* @param self {Object ? null} Reference to the 'this' variable inside
*         the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
*         usually falls back to a default, which is the target
*         by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
*         custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.
* @param capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
*         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
*         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
* @return {String} An opaque ID, which can be used to remove the event listener
*         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
* @throws {Error} if the parameters are wrong

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add an event listener to any valid target. The event listener is passed an instance of {@link qx.event.type.Event} containing all relevant information about the event as parameter.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Name of the event e.g. "click", "keydown", ...

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
self {Object ? null} Reference to the 'this' variable inside
         the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
         usually falls back to a default, which is the target
         by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
         custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.
@param.description:
Reference to the 'this' variable inside
         the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
         usually falls back to a default, which is the target
         by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
         custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque ID, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.description:
An opaque ID, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

raw: * Get the event handler class matching the given event target and type

* null.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the event handler class matching the given event target and type

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.event.IEventHandler|null} The best matching event handler or null.
@return.description: The best matching event handler or null.

* @throws {Error} if there is no handler for the event

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This method is called each time an event listener for one of the supported events is added using {qx.event.Manager#addListener}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean} Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if there is no handler for the event
@throws.description: if there is no handler for the event

raw: * Remove an event listener from an event target.
* @param target {Object} Any valid event target
* @param type {String} Name of the event

* @return {Boolean} Whether the event was removed successfully (was existant)
* @throws {Error} if the parameters are wrong

@param.description: The pointer to the event listener

         the event listener.
@param.description:
Reference to the 'this' variable inside
         the event listener.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to remove the event listener of
         the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
@param.description:
Whether to remove the event listener of
         the bubbling or of the capturing phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event was removed successfully (was existant)
@return.description: Whether the event was removed successfully (was existant)

raw: * This method is called each time the an event listener for one of the
* supported events is removed by using {qx.event.Manager#removeListener}
* and no other event listener is listening on this type.

* @param type {String} event type
* @param capture {Boolean} Whether to attach the event to the
*         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event.
* @throws {Error} if there is no handler for the event

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This method is called each time the an event listener for one of the supported events is removed by using {qx.event.Manager#removeListener} and no other event listener is listening on this type.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean} Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if there is no handler for the event
@throws.description: if there is no handler for the event

raw: * Dispatches an event object using the qooxdoo event handler system. The
* event will only be visible in event listeners attached using
* {@link #addListener}. After dispatching the event object will be pooled
* for later reuse or disposed.
* @param target {Object} Any valid event target
* @param event {qx.event.type.Event} The event object to dispatch. The event
*     object must be obtained using {@link qx.event.Registration#createEvent}
*     and initialized using {@link qx.event.type.Event#init}.
* @return {Boolean|qx.Promise} whether the event default was prevented or not.
*     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
* @throws {Error} if there is no dispatcher for the event

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Dispatches an event object using the qooxdoo event handler system. The event will only be visible in event listeners attached using {@link #addListener}. After dispatching the event object will be pooled for later reuse or disposed.

@param.name: @param

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean|qx.Promise} whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if there is no dispatcher for the event
@throws.description: if there is no dispatcher for the event
